note.p: Birth: St John's,near Trim, Meath, Ireland (1646)
Education: Trinity College, Dublin; BA (1664); Middle Temple (admitted 1677); Oxford; DCL (1677)

Career: Fellow of Trinity (1667); Collector of the Customs in Cork; suspected of participation in the Popish Plot, he was imprisoned (1680); chief Secretary and Commissioner of the Revenue in Ireland (1687); accompanied James II into exile; Private Secretary to James II
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Foster; MT
